# Government Tender Announcement

## Tender Title

TSPS Solutions - Techno-economic Analysis of Hydrogen Energy Systems in Remote and Indigenous Communities

## Tender Summary

Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) is seeking proposals from bidders to evaluate the techno-economic potential, opportunities, and challenges of deploying hydrogen energy systems in Canadian communities not connected to the bulk power grid. This requirement is open to those Supply Arrangement Holders under E60ZT-16TSSB who qualified under Tier 1 and the specified consultant category: Stream 2: Business consulting and change management services.

## Tender Description

The objective of this tender is to assess the feasibility and economic viability of hydrogen energy systems in rural and Indigenous Canadian communities. The scope of work includes an in-depth analysis of the hydrogen value chain, identifying opportunities and challenges for the deployment of these systems. This will inform NRCan's decision-making on the future of hydrogen energy in these communities.

## Eligibility Criteria

To participate in this tender, bidders must meet the following criteria:

* Hold a Supply Arrangement under E60ZT-16TSSB
* Qualified under Tier 1
* Specified consultant category: Stream 2: Business consulting and change management services

## Important Dates

* Tender Closing Date: June 13, 2024, at 14:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: June 1, 2024
* Expected Contract End Date: March 31, 2025

## Tenders Submission Requirements

Proposals must be submitted electronically through the relevant government procurement website. The tender document package includes all the necessary documentation, including the tender template and answer to the questions.

## Scope of Work

The scope of work includes:

* Techno-economic analysis of hydrogen energy systems
* Identification of opportunities and challenges for the deployment of these systems
* Analysis of the hydrogen value chain
* Assessment of the feasibility and economic viability of these systems in Canadian communities

## Evaluation Criteria

The winning bidder will be selected based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price. The evaluation criteria will be outlined in the tender document package.
